column4: If you're getting an error about a shared object not existing, how can you find out what package it belongs to?
it's 3 lines... still want it in #flood?
/usr/local/Adobe/Acrobat7.0/Reader/intellinux/bin/acroread: error while loading shared libraries: libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
and I have libgtk-2.0-0 and all of it's related packages installed already...
interesting... I can get it to work on Gentoo.
agreed.  That's why I now have Ubuntu on this box.
so do you REALLY need acroread
though I'm still considering putting Gentoo back on here, and running it crippled, in pure 32-bit mode, as an Athlon-XP. :/
No, but tell me... what other PDF reader do you know that renders PDFs as well as acroread? :)
So are you a bit disillusioned with AMD64, like me? :/
well I knew it would be this way
It was this, or a Mac, and I thought I could get a LOT more power going this route...
I think until the platform gets more mature, I'm stuck with running 32-bit
